name: Pullman Putrajaya Lakeside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in on Friday, 10 Dec at 1.30 pm, as an Accor member for a complimentary night's stay. Was told to wait for 20 minutes as there was a large group the previous night and cleaning up takes time. Waited at lounge while enjoying a Welcome drink. Returned to reception at 2.45 pm to be told that the rooms were still not ready. After "complaining", was given a room at about 3.15 pm to freshen up and told that a room with a lakeside view would be given to us before 4.00 pm
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went down with luggage to reception at 4.10 pm to check and was still told that the room was not ready. Decided to take the 4.30 pm shuttle service to Alamanda Shopping Centre. Returned at 7.30 pm and was excited to get to our room.
reviews.title: Disappointment in Pullman Putrajaya Lakeside resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was given the key card to Room 3119, a room at Rafflesia with lakeview. Imagine our shock when we discovered that the room was occupied. Went back to reception to tell them our disappointment again.
reviews.title: Pullman " a great stay never forget the best quality & service"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service officer checked and realised the mistake but remarked that the occupants should have already checked out when in actual fact the occupants had just checked in - isn't that a joke? Don't they know?
reviews.title: bugs everywhere poor air-con
A great escape
reviews.text: Anyway, at 8. 20 pm, was "offered" the Executive Room and was ushered to the room by one of the senior service officers. Had originally paid for upgrade to Deluxe Room with balcony.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect hotel and location if you want to get out of KL.
reviews.title: Great escape for weekender

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 3 rooms with friends and decided to stay there to enjoy all their leisure facilities : pool, spa and maritime center next door where you can enjoy all kind of water sports on the lake of Putrajaya.
reviews.title: Excellent place but just need some minor adjustments but none the less very satisfied and enjoyable :)
big diffrence betwen what we suppose to have according to Accord Site compare to what we got !!
reviews.text: This is the only hotel located by the lake and they even have a restaurant on the lake.
Service and staff are good. Recommended for KL expats and families for a weekend break away.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Peaceful Stay but Need a Car

reviews.text: Was there on Wednesday and stayed for a night
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Property convenient to Cyberjaya IT complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really looking forwrad to this hotel, as a stopover hotel, after our 3 week Malaysian Hotel. It is supposedly a 5 star hotel that s close to the KLIA hotel.
reviews.title: Why Bother??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels locationa nd design are most intriguing. It is loacted on the edge of the Putrajaya lake next to the water skiing , rowing area. But very very little else is within 10 mins walk. A huge building is near completion next door who knows what for? As a stopoiver hotel dont waste your money - 65 Rm to the hotel from the airport and 90 rm back from the hotel.
reviews.title: Memorable Stay

reviews.text: It s called a resort but that is tretching it. The pool is very small for such a large hotel. On the second floor, depth 3 - 4 feet!!
reviews.title: The perfect stop-over when driving from Singapore to Penang

reviews.text: Too much of the hotel suffers from design for form rather than function. It is an architects hotel and a poor one at that and not customer friendly. Business centre and lobby are nice but everything else is very tacky. They could have made good use of the grounds to put in a lovely pool are but didnt instead it has a ridiculous clock tower! It is a cement jungle!! Lacks warmth and humanity! Bit like much of Putrajaya really.
reviews.title: Very nice property - Malaysia Truly Asia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is beautiful,but the room is not clean.I don't like the tiles in the bathroom.
reviews.title: room

reviews.text: We stayed at the Pullman putrajaya at the beginning of December and it was quiet indeed. The facilities were as expected from a Pullman.
reviews.title: Somehow really unique, especially the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some activities for the kids around the lake like water skying, sailing, rowing . Bikes can also be rented at the hotel to go around the lake.
reviews.title: Return to Pullman Putrajaya Lakeside
5***** Hotel & Services
reviews.text: Restaurants are offering either a buffet or a la carte.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personnel was very helpful and nice indeed.
reviews.title: Superb for weekender from KL

description: The first premier ‘Malaysian Icon Hotel’, Pullman Putrajaya Lakeside is located 25 minutes from the KL International Airport with easy access to Kuala Lumpur city centre and Sepang Circuit via ERL transit train or by car through a network of highways. It is the epitome of class with exquisite accommodation, contemporary elegant cuisine, large signature spa facilities and an endless array of recreational activities from fitness centre, games & Wii room to kids club and water sports such as canoe, kayak, paddle boat, cruise and water ski.Sprawled over four acres on the shores of the Putrajaya Lake, this spectacular 281 rooms including suites and 34 service apartments’ 5-star hotel is meticulously crafted to depict architecture and ambiance that are distinctively ethnic Malay, Chinese, Indian and of the Borneo continent. Experience Malaysia’s multicultural showcase at its best.
